intro: Galium corsicum var. pallescens, commonly known as the pale willow herb, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often prostrate stems that root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in umbels, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Galium corsicum var. pallescens thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodland floors and stream banks.
